cab.content: 3 j it this Dv...;nent is the Property of(P 2895) From Viceroy, ttth April 1920.(Addressed Peking, repeated to Secretary of Slate.) (Received 15th, 10 a.m.)435 S. Your telegram of 10th April, No. 201, to Foreign Office. Government of India agree that reply to Consul-General should be in the sense indicated by you, and that he should now definitely be instructed not to press Chinese authorities to recognise his right to afford Consular protection to Afghan subjects in Chinese Turkestan. Consul-General had evidently not received latest instructions before he despatched his telegram.
